The ITSO Redbooks team develops and delivers skills, technical know-how, and materials to IBM technical professionals, Business Partners, clients, and the marketplace in general. ITSO's Redbooks objective is to extend the understanding of IBM products and to accelerate the deployment and exploitation of IBM solutions Software Engineer IBM Corporation April 2010  –  February 2011  (11 months) Software Engineer  
Perform software test on IBM Tivoli Productivity Center Application to meet / overachieve release dates by developing and executing test cases, performing product installs, Windows and Linux System administration. 
 
Identified, documented, and tested product defects for Tivoli Productivity Center Release 4.2 at a rate of 4.3% errors per test case which contributed to exceptional product quality.  
Apply AGILE software development methodologies utilizing IBM's Rational Software Suite; collaborating with international teams to identify product defects and issues early in the test cycle, while focusing on customer requirements and satisfaction. Software Engineer - Open Source Management IBM Corporation February 2006  –  February 2009  (3 years 1 month) Software Engineer : Open Source Management 2006 - 2009  
 
Achieved exceptional product quality through effective management of open source processes and open source approval for over 40 IBM products. Conducted legal reviews of product Open Source Proposals to IBM Corporate to accurately identify pedigree of open source and gating issues that could stop release of new products. Open source objectives were accomplished through effective communications and negotiation of technical issues across work teams, which included Corporate Intelletual Property and General Legal Lawyers, Development, Program Managers, Product Test, Vendors, and the IBM Corporate Open Source Core team. 
 
Prepared Open Source Proposals and supporting documents for Legal / Open Source reviews to identify issues and to secure approval required to ship open source in IBM products.  
Analyzed/reviewed product licenses, third party licenses, product notice files and Certificate of Originality (COO) documentation. Provided improvements and revisions critical to shipping open source in IBM products.; Multitasked and adapted to changes in priority by seamlessly shifting between (6) or more concurrent projects on a moment's notice avoiding products missing their release dates. 
Reduced required number of product open source due diligence checklist document approvals by 25%.  
Awarded 'PUBLISH' by IBM Intellectual Properties (IP) Law for disclosure 'Method to Intelligently Handle Registered State Change'. 
Received $2,000 'Bravo' award for excellent Open Source product support and 60% increase of approved open source proposals.  
Earned (9) "Thanks" awards for dedication to product open source management quality and timely approvals and identification of open source related issues to ensure product release dates were met; often ahead of schedule. Mid-range tape Program Manager IBM Corporation February 2006  –  February 2008  (2 years 1 month) IBM Tucson Arizona Program Manager for IBM Mid-range Tape Subsystems Program Manager IBM Corporation February 2006  –  February 2008  (2 years 1 month) Program Manager  
Program Manager for a diverse group of IBM professionals for automated tape products. Led in-house and Vendor Development, Product Test, Reliability Accessibility Serviceability (RAS), Procurement, Marketing, Manufacturing, Education, Human factors, and Publications teams in all phases of the Product development Life Cycle from initial product concept through design, implementation deployment, with high focus on meeting business objectives.  
 
Developed and drove project schedules and dependencies throughout the product life cycle to release IBM's 1st modular, scalable tape library.  
Managed multiple interdependent projects focusing specifically on developing cost estimates, project risk, scope, resource and financial management and project interdependencies contributing to revenue. 
Improved reliability test for the new modular tape library over it's predecessor by (1) million Mean Swaps  
Before Failure (MSBF) as compared to 200K MSBF for the previous product. Software Engineer - Product Tester IBM Corporation January 1995  –  January 2003  (8 years 1 month) Worked in System Level Test as Lead Engineer to coordinate tests for Tape and Disk products to meet / overachieve release dates by planning resources, developing and executing test cases, performing product installs, participating in management meetings, and presenting status to Development, Program Management and Test Management.Debugged problems; assessed risks, and analyzed field problems, and test effectiveness.  
 
Implemented Tivoli Storage Manager Application for first time in Product Test to test backup / retrieval of products in a customer-like environment. This effort assisted the Tivoli Test department in debug of Tivoli Storage Manager and in usage of disk / tape equipment. 
Awarded IBM 700 stock options for high performance in Product Test.  
Collaborated with IBM Global Services to write a white paper on Tivoli Storage Manager "Tape Sharing in a SAN Environment" and with the IBM Almaden Redbook team to write a book on "Storage Area Networks: Tape Future in Fabrics". 
Co-authored a White Paper, which documented a disaster recovery solution. The solution emulated a 24 by-7customer production environment with test scenarios used to demonstrate the capability of IBM storage products to recover customer operations at a secondary site if the primary site failed, including resuming operations on the primary site after a failure. 
Received $2,000 award for contributions as Tape Test lead and Field Build of suite of tape products. Associates Programmer IBM Corporation January 1985  –  January 1995  (10 years 1 month) Designed, implemented, and maintained the accounting, migrate/recall schemes, product build, and install  
programs for IBM backup / restore of customer data on tape and disk products. Maintained applications in  
support of IBM manufacturing. Project Leader Project Leader IBM ITSO Storage Systems Redbooks at Kforce Inc.
